subSubSection.paragraph: Preservation: pinned; specimen intact.

Paratype male with labels: (1) printed with handwritten inscriptions on white label: “
Tibet Medog
/ No. 956 / Chinese Academy of Sciences ”; (2) printed with handwritten inscriptions on white label: “19 80.4.2 / collector
Jianyi Wu
”; (3) printed with handwritten inscriptions on red label: “ PARATYPE /
Alliopsis
/
ventripalmata
/ Fan et Wu ”
.
Preservation: pinned; specimen intact.

Jianyi Wu

ventripalmata
/ Fan et Wu ”
.

Jianyi Wu
”; (3) printed with handwritten inscriptions on red label: “ PARATYPE /
Alliopsis
/
ventripalmata
/ Fan et Wu ”
.
Preservation: pinned; genitalia dissected and mounted on on paper triangle. Missing parts: left mid and hind leg; right legs.
Additional notes: All specimens “ 1980-V-2 ” in original publication, corrected as follows, primarily based on the actual labels of specimens.

Current name:
Alliopsis ventripalmata Fan & Wu, 1983
.
